clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Pranayama on Periodontal Health
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Pranayama on Peroxisome Proliferator-activated Receptor Gamma, Nuclear Factor Kappa B and Red Complex Microorganisms in Patients With Chronic Periodontitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Meenakshi Ammal Dental College and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Meenakshi Ammal Dental College and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study was to evaluate the levels of Peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma (PPAR-γ), Nuclear factor-kappa B (NF-kB) and the presence of red complex microorganisms (RCM) such as Treponema denticola (T.d), Porphyromonas gingivalis (P.g) and Tannerella forsythia (T.f) in the subgingival tissues of chronic periodontitis subjects before and after intervention with pranayama as an adjunct to scaling and root planing.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty chronic periodontitis subjects were selected out of which 30 subjects (control group) were treated with scaling and root planing (SRP) and 30 subjects (pranayama group) also underwent SRP and pranayama for 3 months. Clinical parameters were recorded and the presence of PPAR-γ, NF-kB and RCM were assessed at baseline and after 3 months

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical efficacy of pranayama in chronic periodontitis patients from baseline to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Clinical attachment level is measured using Williams periodontal probe in millimeters with the criteria of 1 to 2 mm for slight periodontitis, 3 to 4 mm for moderate periodontits and greater or equal to 5 mm for severe periodontitis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological efficacy of pranayama in chronic periodontitis patients from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Red complex microorganisms such as P.gingivalis, T.denticola, T.forsythia are identified as '0' for absence and '1' for presence and analysed using polymerase chain reaction from subgingival plaque samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of pranayama on nuclear factor-kappa B (NF-kB) in chronic periodontitis patients
secondary_outcome.description: The expression of NF-kB is analysed using Real time PCR after isolation of RNA from subgingival plaque samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of pranayama on perosxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR)-γ in chronic periodontitis patients
secondary_outcome.description: The expression of PPAR- γ is analysed using Real time PCR after isolation of RNA from subgingival plaque samples.

arm_group.description: 30 chronic periodontitis subjects treated with SRP & pranayama for 3 months
30 chronic periodontitis subjects treated with scaling and root planing only

intervention.description: Pranayama is the breathing exercise through the nostrils. It enhances the systemic immunity which in turn enhances the overall defense mechanism of an individual.
It is a mechanical debridement of dental plaque.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- presence of at least 20 teeth
- Probing pocket depth ≥ 5 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- aggressive periodontitis
- systemic disorders
- pregnant & lactating females
- smokers & alcoholics
- immunocompromised individuals
